result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lillian J Richardson

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Lillian J Richardson in court.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court by ADA Samuel Berg. Called @ 2:17 p.m. Appearances made. Matter before the Court for initial appearance. Court goes over charges, penalties, and right to attorney with the defendant. SPD information provided to defendant and matter set over for attorney.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for November 10, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Signed bond filed with the court.

Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.
22-4627

Defendant Lillian J Richardson in court, in custody by video. Attorney Mackenzie Renner appeared for bond purposes only. JJ Crawford appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Signature bond set. Minutes filed.
Hearing scheduled for October 19, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
